verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, That there be some of them that stand here, which shall not taste of death, till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power.
verses.web: He said to them, “Most certainly I tell you, there are some standing here who will in no way taste death until they see God’s Kingdom come with power.”
verses.ct: Then he told them, "I tell you the truth: some of you standing here right now will not die before you see the kingdom of God arrive with power."

verses.kjv: And after six days Jesus taketh with him Peter, and James, and John, and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves: and he was transfigured before them.
verses.web: After six days Jesus took with him Peter, James, and John, and brought them up onto a high mountain privately by themselves, and he was changed into another form in front of them.
verses.ct: 6 days later, Jesus took Peter, James, and John and led them up a high mountain where they were completely alone. There, right before their eyes, his appearance was transformed.

verses.kjv: And his raiment became shining, exceeding white as snow; so as no fuller on earth can white them.
verses.web: His clothing became glistening, exceedingly white, like snow, such as no launderer on earth can whiten them.
verses.ct: His clothes became dazzling white — brighter than snow, whiter than any bleach on earth could ever make them.

verses.kjv: And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses: and they were talking with Jesus.
verses.web: Elijah and Moses appeared to them, and they were talking with Jesus.
verses.ct: Then Elijah and Moses appeared and began talking with Jesus.

verses.kjv: And Peter answered and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.
verses.web: Peter answered Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let’s make three tents: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
verses.ct: Peter blurted out, "Rabbi, this is amazing! Let us build 3 shelters — one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah."

verses.kjv: For he wist not what to say; for they were sore afraid.
verses.web: For he didn’t know what to say, for they were very afraid.
verses.ct: He didn't really know what he was saying because they were all terrified.

verses.kjv: And there was a cloud that overshadowed them: and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.
verses.web: A cloud came, overshadowing them, and a voice came out of the cloud, “This is my beloved Son. Listen to him.”
verses.ct: Then a cloud came down and covered them, and a voice spoke from the cloud: "This is my beloved Son. Listen to him."

verses.kjv: And suddenly, when they had looked round about, they saw no man any more, save Jesus only with themselves.
verses.web: Suddenly looking around, they saw no one with them any more, except Jesus only.
verses.ct: Suddenly, when they looked around, Moses and Elijah were gone. Only Jesus was with them.

verses.kjv: And as they came down from the mountain, he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen, till the Son of man were risen from the dead.
verses.web: As they were coming down from the mountain, he commanded them that they should tell no one what things they had seen, until after the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
verses.ct: As they made their way down the mountain, Jesus ordered them not to tell anyone what they had seen until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.

verses.kjv: And they kept that saying with themselves, questioning one with another what the rising from the dead should mean.
verses.web: They kept this saying to themselves, questioning what the “rising from the dead” meant.
verses.ct: They kept it to themselves, but they debated with each other about what "rising from the dead" could mean.

verses.kjv: And they asked him, saying, Why say the scribes that Elias must first come?
verses.web: They asked him, saying, “Why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
verses.ct: They asked him, "Why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?"

verses.kjv: And he answered and told them, Elias verily cometh first, and restoreth all things; and how it is written of the Son of man, that he must suffer many things, and be set at nought.
verses.web: He said to them, “Elijah indeed comes first, and restores all things. How is it written about the Son of Man, that he should suffer many things and be despised?
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Elijah does come first to restore everything. But then why do the Scriptures say that the Son of Man must suffer terribly and be rejected?"

verses.kjv: But I say unto you, That Elias is indeed come, and they have done unto him whatsoever they listed, as it is written of him.
verses.web: But I tell you that Elijah has come, and they have also done to him whatever they wanted to, even as it is written about him.”
verses.ct: "I'm telling you, Elijah has already come, and people did whatever they wanted to him — just as the Scriptures said they would."

verses.kjv: And when he came to his disciples, he saw a great multitude about them, and the scribes questioning with them.
verses.web: Coming to the disciples, he saw a great multitude around them, and scribes questioning them.
verses.ct: When they returned to the other disciples, they found a large crowd gathered around them, with scribes arguing with them.

verses.kjv: And straightway all the people, when they beheld him, were greatly amazed, and running to him saluted him.
verses.web: Immediately all the multitude, when they saw him, were greatly amazed, and running to him, greeted him.
verses.ct: The moment the crowd spotted Jesus, they were amazed and ran over to greet him.

verses.kjv: And he asked the scribes, What question ye with them?
verses.web: He asked the scribes, “What are you asking them?”
verses.ct: He asked the scribes, "What are you arguing with them about?"

verses.kjv: And one of the multitude answered and said, Master, I have brought unto thee my son, which hath a dumb spirit;
verses.web: One of the multitude answered, “Teacher, I brought to you my son, who has a mute spirit;
verses.ct: A man in the crowd spoke up: "Teacher, I brought my son to you. He's possessed by a spirit that has made him unable to speak."

verses.kjv: And wheresoever he taketh him, he teareth him: and he foameth, and gnasheth with his teeth, and pineth away: and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out; and they could not.
verses.web: and wherever it seizes him, it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth, and grinds his teeth, and wastes away. I asked your disciples to cast it out, and they weren’t able.”
verses.ct: "Whenever it seizes him, it throws him to the ground. He foams at the mouth, grinds his teeth, and his body wastes away. I asked your disciples to drive it out, but they couldn't do it."

verses.kjv: He answereth him, and saith, O faithless generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him unto me.
verses.web: He answered him, “Unbelieving generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him to me.”
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "You faithless generation! How long must I stay with you? How long must I put up with this? Bring the boy to me."

verses.kjv: And they brought him unto him: and when he saw him, straightway the spirit tare him; and he fell on the ground, and wallowed foaming.
verses.web: They brought him to him, and when he saw him, immediately the spirit convulsed him, and he fell on the ground, wallowing and foaming at the mouth.
verses.ct: So they brought the boy. The moment the spirit saw Jesus, it threw the boy into violent convulsions. He fell to the ground, rolling around and foaming at the mouth.

verses.kjv: And he asked his father, How long is it ago since this came unto him? And he said, Of a child.
verses.web: He asked his father, “How long has it been since this has come to him?” He said, “From childhood.
verses.ct: Jesus asked the father, "How long has this been happening to him?" The father answered, "Since he was a small child."

verses.kjv: And ofttimes it hath cast him into the fire, and into the waters, to destroy him: but if thou canst do any thing, have compassion on us, and help us.
verses.web: Often it has cast him both into the fire and into the water to destroy him. But if you can do anything, have compassion on us, and help us.”
verses.ct: "It has thrown him into fire and into water over and over, trying to kill him. But if you can do anything at all, please have compassion on us and help us."

verses.kjv: Jesus said unto him, If thou canst believe, all things are possible to him that believeth.
verses.web: Jesus said to him, “If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes.”
verses.ct: Jesus said to him, "'If you can'? Everything is possible for the one who believes."

verses.kjv: And straightway the father of the child cried out, and said with tears, Lord, I believe; help thou mine unbelief.
verses.web: Immediately the father of the child cried out with tears, “I believe. Help my unbelief!”
verses.ct: Immediately the boy's father cried out through his tears, "I do believe! Help me overcome my unbelief!"

verses.kjv: When Jesus saw that the people came running together, he rebuked the foul spirit, saying unto him, Thou dumb and deaf spirit, I charge thee, come out of him, and enter no more into him.
verses.web: When Jesus saw that a multitude came running together, he rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to him, “You mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out of him, and never enter him again!”
verses.ct: When Jesus saw that a crowd was rushing toward them, he rebuked the unclean spirit. "You deaf and mute spirit," he commanded, "I order you — come out of him and never enter him again!"

verses.kjv: And the spirit cried, and rent him sore, and came out of him: and he was as one dead; insomuch that many said, He is dead.
verses.web: After crying out and convulsing him greatly, it came out of him. The boy became like one dead, so much that most of them said, “He is dead.”
verses.ct: The spirit screamed, threw the boy into terrible convulsions, and came out. The boy lay there motionless, looking so lifeless that most of the people said, "He's dead."

verses.kjv: But Jesus took him by the hand, and lifted him up; and he arose.
verses.web: But Jesus took him by the hand, and raised him up; and he arose.
verses.ct: But Jesus took him by the hand and lifted him up, and the boy stood on his feet.

verses.kjv: And when he was come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, Why could not we cast him out?
verses.web: When he had come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, “Why couldn’t we cast it out?”
verses.ct: Later, when Jesus had gone inside a house, his disciples asked him privately, "Why couldn't we drive it out?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, This kind can come forth by nothing, but by prayer and fasting.
verses.web: He said to them, “This kind can come out by nothing, except by prayer and fasting.”
verses.ct: He told them, "This kind can only be driven out through prayer and fasting."

verses.kjv: And they departed thence, and passed through Galilee; and he would not that any man should know it.
verses.web: They went out from there, and passed through Galilee. He didn’t want anyone to know it.
verses.ct: They left that area and traveled through Galilee. Jesus didn't want anyone to know where they were,

verses.kjv: For he taught his disciples, and said unto them, The Son of man is delivered into the hands of men, and they shall kill him; and after that he is killed, he shall rise the third day.
verses.web: For he was teaching his disciples, and said to them, “The Son of Man is being handed over to the hands of men, and they will kill him; and when he is killed, on the third day he will rise again.”
verses.ct: because he was teaching his disciples. He told them, "The Son of Man is going to be handed over to men who will kill him. But 3 days after he is killed, he will rise again."

verses.kjv: But they understood not that saying, and were afraid to ask him.
verses.web: But they didn’t understand the saying, and were afraid to ask him.
verses.ct: They didn't understand what he meant, and they were too afraid to ask him about it.

verses.kjv: And he came to Capernaum: and being in the house he asked them, What was it that ye disputed among yourselves by the way?
verses.web: He came to Capernaum, and when he was in the house he asked them, “What were you arguing among yourselves on the way?”
verses.ct: They arrived in Capernaum, and once they were inside the house, Jesus asked them, "What were you arguing about on the road?"

verses.kjv: But they held their peace: for by the way they had disputed among themselves, who should be the greatest.
verses.web: But they were silent, for they had disputed with one another on the way about who was the greatest.
verses.ct: They stayed silent, because they had been arguing about which of them was the greatest.

verses.kjv: And he sat down, and called the twelve, and saith unto them, If any man desire to be first, the same shall be last of all, and servant of all.
verses.web: He sat down, and called the twelve; and he said to them, “If any man wants to be first, he shall be last of all, and servant of all.”
verses.ct: Jesus sat down, called the 12 over, and said, "If anyone wants to be first, he must put himself last and be the servant of everyone else."

verses.kjv: And he took a child, and set him in the midst of them: and when he had taken him in his arms, he said unto them,
verses.web: He took a little child, and set him in the middle of them. Taking him in his arms, he said to them,
verses.ct: He brought a little child over and stood the child in the middle of them. Then he picked the child up in his arms and said,

verses.kjv: Whosoever shall receive one of such children in my name, receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me, receiveth not me, but him that sent me.
verses.web: “Whoever receives one such little child in my name, receives me, and whoever receives me, doesn’t receive me, but him who sent me.”
verses.ct: "Anyone who welcomes a little child like this in my name is welcoming me. And anyone who welcomes me isn't just welcoming me — they're welcoming the one who sent me."

verses.kjv: And John answered him, saying, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name, and he followeth not us: and we forbad him, because he followeth not us.
verses.web: John said to him, “Teacher, we saw someone who doesn’t follow us casting out demons in your name; and we forbade him, because he doesn’t follow us.”
verses.ct: John said to him, "Teacher, we saw someone driving out demons using your name, and we tried to stop him because he isn't one of us."

verses.kjv: But Jesus said, Forbid him not: for there is no man which shall do a miracle in my name, that can lightly speak evil of me.
verses.web: But Jesus said, “Don’t forbid him, for there is no one who will do a mighty work in my name, and be able quickly to speak evil of me.
verses.ct: But Jesus said, "Don't stop him. No one who performs a miracle in my name will be able to turn around and speak against me.

verses.kjv: For he that is not against us is on our part.
verses.web: For whoever is not against us is on our side.
verses.ct: Whoever is not against us is for us.

verses.kjv: For whosoever shall give you a cup of water to drink in my name, because ye belong to Christ, verily I say unto you, he shall not lose his reward.
verses.web: For whoever will give you a cup of water to drink in my name, because you are Christ’s, most certainly I tell you, he will in no way lose his reward.
verses.ct: I tell you the truth: anyone who gives you even a cup of water because you belong to Christ will certainly receive their reward.

verses.kjv: And whosoever shall offend one of these little ones that believe in me, it is better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he were cast into the sea.
verses.web: Whoever will cause one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for him if he were thrown into the sea with a millstone hung around his neck.
verses.ct: But if anyone causes one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for that person to have a massive millstone tied around their neck and be thrown into the sea.

verses.kjv: And if thy hand offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter into life maimed, than having two hands to go into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched:
verses.web: If your hand causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life maimed, rather than having your two hands to go into Gehenna, into the unquenchable fire,
verses.ct: If your hand causes you to sin, cut it off. It's better to enter life missing a hand than to have both hands and be thrown into hell, into the fire that never goes out,

verses.kjv: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.
verses.web: ‘where their worm doesn’t die, and the fire is not quenched.’
verses.ct: where the worm never dies and the fire is never quenched.

verses.kjv: And if thy foot offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter halt into life, than having two feet to be cast into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched:
verses.web: If your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life lame, rather than having your two feet to be cast into Gehenna, into the fire that will never be quenched—
verses.ct: If your foot causes you to sin, cut it off. It's better to enter life lame than to have both feet and be thrown into hell, into the fire that never goes out,

verses.kjv: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.
verses.web: ‘where their worm doesn’t die, and the fire is not quenched.’
verses.ct: where the worm never dies and the fire is never quenched.

verses.kjv: And if thine eye offend thee, pluck it out: it is better for thee to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye, than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire:
verses.web: If your eye causes you to stumble, cast it out. It is better for you to enter into God’s Kingdom with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire,
verses.ct: If your eye causes you to sin, tear it out. It's better to enter the kingdom of God with one eye than to have both eyes and be thrown into the fire of hell,

verses.kjv: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.
verses.web: ‘where their worm doesn’t die, and the fire is not quenched.’
verses.ct: where the worm never dies and the fire is never quenched.

verses.kjv: For every one shall be salted with fire, and every sacrifice shall be salted with salt.
verses.web: For everyone will be salted with fire, and every sacrifice will be seasoned with salt.
verses.ct: Everyone will be salted with fire, and every sacrifice will be seasoned with salt.

verses.kjv: Salt is good: but if the salt have lost his saltness, wherewith will ye season it? Have salt in yourselves, and have peace one with another.
verses.web: Salt is good, but if the salt has lost its saltiness, with what will you season it? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with one another.”
verses.ct: Salt is good, but if salt loses its flavor, how can you make it salty again? Have salt among yourselves, and be at peace with one another."
